reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Life-Saving project for affected people in Homs

description.narrative: One hundred thousand people inhabit Wa’er area, which is considered as a hard-to-reach area, has become safer in current time. Al-Waleed hospital is the only public hospital in the area, but it is 80% ruined. Since Al-Birr association has its own hospital "Al-Birr Hospital", which is considered one of the largest hospitals in Syria. The hospital combines eleven floors and 150 beds in different medical specialties, provided with all services for free or semi-free, but it needs a rehabilitation and maintenance for its various medical departments, in addition to many new equipment that have been destroyed due to war. The hospital currently operates 25% of its total ability. Incubators department need a 10KVA generator to operate the department In addition to maintenance of children incubators and oxygen tents. Gynecological department needs a rehabilitation, an anesthesia machine and an operations table. Surgery department needs a rehabilitation, an electric coagulator, defibrillator, and a wet medical sterilization device. Concerning intensive care unit, it need a maintenance of monitor devices, a 10 KVA generator to reoperate the department, three new monitor devices, six Injectors, an artificial ventilator, a defibrillator, and ECG. Radiology department and the laboratory, which are considered the most affected sections in the hospital, need a rehabilitation, an Automatic Chemistry device, and an Electrolytes device. The association has had a clinic, which has offered Therapeutic and emergency services 24/7 in Al-Hamideya. Al-Hamidia, which is located in Old City of Homs, has got back to how it was before the crisis, and now, 8000 people inhabit it. Therefore, the association thinks that it is essential to insure a rehabilitation to that clinic, and provide it with all the medical equipment that are needed such as: X-ray equipment, a laboratory, various clinics equipment, ECG, Echograph, a dental clinic and an ambulance to provide night services. Al- Birr association has an eligible staff of doctors, nurses and an administrative staff, which has high experience in providing health services Al-Hamideya Clinic, which has been established since 1994, has never stopped working since 1994 except during the crisis, the clinics that operate in Wa’er area as well. The association also has the ability to transport patients to and from hard-to-reach areas through ceoordination with government and obtaining the necessary approvals. The project aims to strengthen the health services with the aim of life sustaining through the provision of medical assistance and surgical aids in ICU and other departments for people in need.
